titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Health Officer was an official of Philadelphia's Board of Health who had responsibility for tracking ships arriving in the port from US and foreign ports, examining the accounts of inspectors of incoming vessels, enforcing quarantines, recording diseases of an infectious nature, and reporting regularly to the Board of Health. The Health Officer worked with other Board of Health officials, including the Port Physician, the Lazaretto (or quarantine) Physician, and the Quarantine Master.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia Health Office, register of vessels, 1797-1801 kept by William Allen, Health Officer of the Port of Philadelphia and William Nesbitt, Clerk of the Health Office. Information provided is date of arrival, name of vessel, name of commander, name of port from which last sailed, consignees, fees collected, and the number of passengers and seamen on each vessel. Some entries also include the name of the pilot. Of note is a record of the arrival on August 21, 1800 of schooner Prudence, a prize of US ship of war Ganges, which carried 16 black slaves.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Pennsylvania State Archives: RG-41 Records of the Navigation Commission for the Delaware River, 41.9: Health Officer's Account of Passenger Entries, 1789-1794.
